abstracts.cdata!:
The District Heating Project seeks to
            promote Hrvatska Elektropriveda Toplinarstvo's (HEPT)
            operational efficiency in Croatia, by reducing energy and
            water losses; increasing the profitability of HEPT; and
            increasing the level of customer satisfaction. The project
            has two components : 1) the Infrastructure Rehabilitation
            component includes the following investments: Zagreb network
            rehabilitation entails the replacement of a dual pipe trench
            (35 km), transmission pipes (20 km), and distribution pipes
            (15 km). These investments were identified as priority
            rehabilitation investments where energy and water losses are
            high; and, Osijek network rehabilitation entails the
            replacement of distribution pipes (1 5 km) and connection to
            the main combined heat power (CHP) plant of customers
            currently connected to the inefficient local heat only
            boilers. 2) the consulting services component includes: the
            development of a demand side management (DSM) Program, where
            HEPT will look at options to promote voluntary installation
            of DSM equipment. The component further includes the
            completion of two surveys in Zagreb and Osijek; preparation
            of bidding documents; construction supervision; and,
            preparation of annual audits.
